>Try to keep the insta-deaths at a minimum

It depends on the overall balance of the character.  Right now, 
clerics have an instant death attack against both ghosts and 
skeletons, but there's a balance to go with it.
 
> though because if computer AI is improved, say then you have an 
 impossible level XX Assasin to kill, the levels could become near 
impossible.

I disagree with giving a cloaked character the ability to kill 
characters with a single attack.  The problem is you couldn't protect 
your troops well enough and the assasin overall has plenty of ways to 
damage characters.

> I think create blackhole should gravitate people towards 
 it and hurt them at a constant rate when they approach the center. 

This is where I disagree strongly.  Aside from basic attack and black 
hole, the rest of a practical mage's abilities are about assisting 
characters in a battle.  A really powerfull attack is needed to 
balance out the character and using black hole to kill characters 
makes logic sense, especially since the black hole kills both 
teammates and opponents.  Besides that, a black hole would be a 
constant drain on the practical mage's mana and when the practical 
mage runs out of mana, the black hole disappears.

As usual, it's ok to disagree.
